subject: Physical Fitness
title: The Bed Rest Myth
description: One-minute skill: The Bed Rest Myth.

hook.text: Hurt your back? Lie in bed for a week. Doctors prescribed this for decades. It made things catastrophically worse.

buildup.text: Bed rest was standard treatment for back pain until the 1990s. Patients were told to stay immobile.

discovery.text: Extended bed rest causes muscle atrophy, bone loss, cardiovascular decline, and increased pain sensitivity.

twist.text: Research now shows early movement after injury produces faster recovery than rest in almost all conditions.

climax.text: Controlled, pain-guided movement is the modern standard. Rest is measured in hours, not weeks.

punchline.text: Rest heals for a day. Movement heals for a lifetime. Move as soon as you can.

quiz.question: Why is prolonged bed rest no longer recommended for most injuries?
options: It causes muscle loss, bone loss, and increased pain sensitivity
It is too comfortable and people refuse to leave bed
Modern beds are too soft for recovery
